bs.label: The carrying amounts of cash equivalents items which are restricted as to withdrawal or usage; the restriction relates to restricted deposits held to retire notes payable.

Consolidation of inventory relating to land and lot option purchases contracts in which the entity is deemed to be the primary beneficiary of the arrangements and a transaction that did not qualify as a sale of inventory under current accounting standards thus the inventory remained on the entity's balance sheet.

Includes the liabilities related to the remaining exercise price of land and lot option purchases contracts and the entity's cash received and contribution made related to the sale of inventory to a joint venture that did not qualify as a sale under the current accounting standards.

Including the current and noncurrent portions, aggregate carrying amount of all types of notes payable, as of the balance-sheet date, with initial maturities beyond one year or beyond the normal operating cycle, if longer. And including the carrying amount as of the balance sheet date of liabilities not individually reported in the financial statements, or not separately disclosed in notes.

ic.label: This element represents the total of the costs and expenses related to real estate revenues and the aggregate total costs related to selling a firm's product and services, as well as all other general and administrative expenses.
This element represents the costs incurred for servicing the portfolios of real estate loans acquired including general and administrative expenses.

Sum of operating profit, nonoperating income (expense) and equity method investments before income taxes, extraordinary items, cumulative effects of changes in accounting principles and noncontrolling interests.
Aggregated revenue recognized during the period (derived from accretable interest income and sub-advisory services fees)

cf.label: The cash outflow associated with the purchase of loans receivables and real estate owned properties during the period.
Value of debts payable that were consolidated during the period in non-cash consolidations
The net cash inflow (outflow) from the purchase (sale) of loans held for investment purposes during the period.

The cash inflow associated with the amount of dividends or other distributions received from unconsolidated subsidiaries, certain corporate joint ventures, and certain noncontrolled corporations that constitute a return of investment; these investments are accounted for under the equity method of accounting. This element excludes distributions that are classified as operating activities.
Cash outflow to purchase lots from an unconsolidated subsidiary that were previously sold to that unconsolidated subsidiary with an option to repurchase the lots.
Amount represents the difference between the fair value of the payments made and the carrying amount of the other debt at the time of its extinguishment.

The net gain or loss resulting from sales and other disposals of real estate owned, increases and decreases in the valuation allowance for foreclosed real estate, and write-downs of other real estate owned after acquisition or physical possesion.

The net cash inflow (outflow) for the net change associated with funds that are not available for withdrawal or use (such as Rialto Investments defeasance cash to retire notes payable) and are associated with underlying transactions that are classified as investing activities.
Value of inventories that were consolidated during the period in non-cash  consolidations.
Value of investments in consolidated entities that were consolidated during the period in non-cash consolidations.
Value of investments in unconsolidated entities that were consolidated during the period in non-cash consolidations.
Value of loans receivables that were consolidated during the period in non-cash consolidations.
The net change during the period associated with the purchase or sale of long-lived, physical assets.

Non-cash contributions to an entity that is related to the Company but not strictly controlled (for example an unconsolidated subsidiary, affiliate, and joint venture or equity method investment) during the period.

Non-cash distributions to an entity that is related to the Company but it is not strictly controlled (for example an unconsolidated subsidiary, affiliate, and joint venture or equity method investments) during the period.
Value of noncontrolling interests that were consolidated during the period in non-cash consolidations.
Value of other assets that were consolidated during the period in non-cash consolidations.
Value of other liabilities that were consolidated during the period in non-cash consolidations

The cash outflow associated with the acquisition of or advances to an entity that was consolidated (for example, an unconsolidated subsidiary, affiliate, and joint venture or equity method investment) or the acquisition of an additional interest in the consolidated entity.

The net cash inflow (outflow) from a contractual arrangement with the lender, including letter of credit, standby letter of credit and revolving credit arrangements, under which borrowings can be made up to a specific amount at any point in time with either short term or long term maturity that is collateralized (backed by pledge, mortgage or other lien in the entity's assets).
The cash inflow from proceeds from Sales of real estate owned.
Purchases of inventory financed by sellers during the period in non-cash transactions.
Purchases of real estate portfolios financed by sellers during the period in non-cash transactions.
Value of real estate acquired through, or in lieu of, foreclosure during the period in non-cash transactions.
Cash inflow associated with the receipt of principal payments on loans receivables.
Value of receivables that were consolidated during the period in non-cash consolidations.
